data.title: Claudiu Keșerü - Grokipedia
data.snippet:
## Career statistics

### Club

Claudiu Keșerü's club career encompassed 21 seasons across Romania, France, Qatar, and Bulgaria, where he amassed 618 appearances, 277 goals, and 81 assists in all competitions combined. His most prolific period came at Ludogorets Razgrad, contributing 142 goals in 247 appearances across domestic and European fixtures. In domestic leagues, Keșerü recorded 494 appearances and 215 goals, with notable contributions in the Romanian Liga I (44 goals in 100 appearances post-2014, primarily during his FCSB stints) and the Bulgarian Parva Liga, where he ranks third all-time with 119 goals in 184 appearances. The following table summarizes his seasonal statistics in domestic leagues: [...] Claudiu Andrei Keșerü (born 2 December 1986) is a Romanian former professional footballer who played as a striker, known for his prolific goal-scoring in multiple European leagues. Over a career spanning more than two decades, he represented clubs in Romania, France, Qatar, and Bulgaria, amassing over 500 appearances and more than 250 goals across domestic competitions. Internationally, Keșerü earned 46 caps for the Romania national team between 2013 and 2021, scoring 13 goals, including several in UEFA European Championship qualifiers. Keșerü began his professional career with FC Bihor Oradea in 2003 before moving to France, where he spent nearly a decade with clubs including Nantes, Angers, and Bastia, playing over 150 matches in Ligue 1 and Ligue 2. In 2014, he returned to Romania with [...] Claudiu Keșerü joined Ludogorets Razgrad from Al-Gharafa on August 13, 2015, signing a three-year contract for a transfer fee of €1 million. Over the course of his tenure from 2015 to 2021, he made 243 appearances across all competitions, scoring 139 goals and providing 44 assists, establishing himself as the club's all-time leading scorer. In the Bulgarian First League (Parva Liga), he amassed 119 goals in 184 matches, becoming the most prolific foreign player in the competition's history. His arrival bolstered Ludogorets' attack during a dominant era, contributing to six consecutive league titles from the 2015–16 to 2020–21 seasons. Keșerü's individual brilliance shone in the Parva Liga, where he claimed the top scorer title in the 2016–17 season with 22 goals and in 2020–21 with 22

data.title: Claudiu Keșerü - Wikipedia
data.snippet:
Claudiu Andrei Keșerü (Romanian pronunciation: (/wiki/Help:IPA/Romanian "Help:IPA/Romanian"); born 2 December 1986) is a Romanian former professional footballer who played as a striker#Striker "Forward (association football)").

After starting out at his hometown side Bihor Oradea "FC Bihor Oradea (1958)"), Keșerü soon moved to Nantes in 2003. Over the course of nearly eleven years in France, he represented five clubs and amassed Ligue 1 and Ligue 2 totals of 240 appearances and 67 goals. In 2014, he returned to his native country by signing a contract with defending champions Steaua București. [...] | Keșerü with Ludogorets Razgrad in 2019 |

| 2014–2015 | FCSB | 34 | (20) | [...] Keșerü also had a brief spell with Al-Gharafa in Qatar, before moving to Ludogorets Razgrad in the summer of 2015. He netted more than 110 times in the Bulgarian First League "First Professional Football League (Bulgaria)") and became the foreign player with the most goals in the competition. Keșerü is also the only foreigner to become season top scorer in Bulgaria on more than one occasion. In 2021, he returned to Steaua București—now renamed FCSB.

Keșerü made his first senior international appearance for Romania in October 2013, in a 4–0 defeat of Andorra. He earned over 40 caps "Cap (sport)") for the nation and was part of the squad that participated in UEFA Euro 2016.
